1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 
3 # Lib
4 import copy
5 import numpy as np
6 
7 from tf.transformations import quaternion_from_euler, euler_from_quaternion, quaternion_multiply
8 
9 # Messages
10 from geometry_msgs.msg import Pose, Point, Quaternion, Twist, Vector3
11 
12 from niryo_robot_msgs.msg import RPY
13 
14 
15 # - Useful functions
16 def pose_to_list(pose):
17  """
18  Take a ROS Pose and return it as a Python list [x, y, z, roll, pitch, yaw]
19 
20  :param pose: a Pose
21  :type pose: Pose
22  :return: The pose as a list
23  :rtype: list[float]
24  """
25  x, y, z = pose.position.x, pose.position.y, pose.position.z
26  roll, pitch, yaw = euler_from_quaternion(
27  [pose.orientation.x, pose.orientation.y, pose.orientation.z,
28  pose.orientation.w])
29  return [x, y, z, roll, pitch, yaw]
30 
31 
32 def list_to_pose(list_):
33  """
34  Take a Pose as a Python list [x, y, z, roll, pitch, yaw] and return a ROS Pose
35 
36  :param list_: a pose in a list
37  :type list_: list[float]
38  :return: a ROS Pose
39  :rtype: Pose
40  """
41  x, y, z = list_[:3]
42  q_x, q_y, q_z, q_w = quaternion_from_euler(*list_[3:])
43 
44  return Pose(Point(x, y, z), Quaternion(q_x, q_y, q_z, q_w))
45 
46 
47 def dist_2_poses(p1, p2):
48  """
49  :param p1:
50  :type p1: Pose
51  :param p2:
52  :type p2: Pose
53 
54  :return: The distance (in meters) between the two poses
55  :rtype: float
56  """
57  np_pose1 = np.array([
58  p1.position.x,
59  p1.position.y,
60  p1.position.z,
61  p1.orientation.x,
62  p1.orientation.y,
63  p1.orientation.z,
64  p1.orientation.w
65  ])
66  np_pose2 = np.array([
67  p2.position.x,
68  p2.position.y,
69  p2.position.z,
70  p2.orientation.x,
71  p2.orientation.y,
72  p2.orientation.z,
73  p2.orientation.w
74  ])
75 
76  return np.linalg.norm(np_pose1 - np_pose2)
77 
78 
79 def dist_2_points(p1, p2):
80  """
81  :param p1:
82  :type p1: Pose
83  :param p2:
84  :type p2: Pose
85 
86  :return: The distance (in meters) between the two poses
87  :rtype: float
88  """
89  np_point1 = np.array([p1.x, p1.y, p1.z])
90  np_point2 = np.array([p2.x, p2.y, p2.z])
91 
92  return np.linalg.norm(np_point1 - np_point2)
93 
94 
95 def angle_between_2_points(p1, p2):
96  np_point1 = np.array([p1.x, p1.y, p1.z])
97  np_point2 = np.array([p2.x, p2.y, p2.z])
98 
99  unit_vector_1 = np_point1 / np.linalg.norm(np_point1)
100  unit_vector_2 = np_point2 / np.linalg.norm(np_point2)
101  dot_product = np.dot(unit_vector_1, unit_vector_2)
102  angle = np.arccos(dot_product)
103 
104  return angle
105 
106 
107 def poses_too_close(p1, p2):
108  """
109  Check that distance between p1 and p2 is bigger than the minimal required distance for a move.
110 
111  :param p1:
112  :type p1: Pose
113  :param p2:
114  :type p2: Pose
115 
116  :return: True if the distance between p1 and p2 is smaller than 1mm
117  :rtype: bool
118  """
119  np_pose1 = np.array([
120  p1.position.x,
121  p1.position.y,
122  p1.position.z,
123  p1.orientation.x,
124  p1.orientation.y,
125  p1.orientation.z,
126  p1.orientation.w
127  ])
128  np_pose2 = np.array([
129  p2.position.x,
130  p2.position.y,
131  p2.position.z,
132  p2.orientation.x,
133  p2.orientation.y,
134  p2.orientation.z,
135  p2.orientation.w
136  ])
137 
138  dist = np.linalg.norm(np_pose1 - np_pose2)
139 
140  return dist < 0.001
141 
142 
143 def invert_quat(q):
144  q_inv = copy.deepcopy(q)
145  if isinstance(q_inv, Quaternion):
146  q_inv.w = -q.w
147  elif isinstance(q_inv, list):
148  q_inv[3] = -q[3]
149  else:
150  raise TypeError
151  return q_inv
152 
153 
154 def diff_quat(q1, q2):
155  q1_list = [q1.x, q1.y, q1.z, q1.w] if isinstance(q1, Quaternion) else q1
156  q2_list = [q2.x, q2.y, q2.z, q2.w] if isinstance(q2, Quaternion) else q2
157 
158  q2_inv = invert_quat(q2_list)
159 
160  return quaternion_multiply(q1_list, q2_inv)
161 
162 
163 def get_orientation_from_angles(r, p, y):
164  quaternion = quaternion_from_euler(r, p, y)
165  orientation = Quaternion()
166  orientation.x = quaternion[0]
167  orientation.y = quaternion[1]
168  orientation.z = quaternion[2]
169  orientation.w = quaternion[3]
170  return orientation
171 
172 
173 def get_rpy_from_quaternion(rot):
174  euler = euler_from_quaternion(rot)
175  # Force angles in [-PI, PI]
176  for i, angle in enumerate(euler):
177  if angle > np.pi:
178  euler[i] = angle % (2 * np.pi) - 2 * np.pi
179  elif angle < -np.pi:
180  euler[i] = angle % (2 * np.pi)
181  return euler
182 
183 
184 def quaternion_to_list(quat):
185  return [quat.x, quat.y, quat.z, quat.w]
186 
187 
188 def vector3_to_list(vect):
189  return [vect.x, vect.y, vect.z]
190 
191 
192 def list_to_vector3(list_):
193  return Vector3(x=list_[0], y=list_[1], z=list_[2])
194 
195 
196 def list_to_rpy(list_):
197  return RPY(roll=list_[0], pitch=list_[1], yaw=list_[2])
